intro: Dalechampia stipulacea var. bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá dalechampia, is a tropical plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically arranged in a pinnate pattern, and its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. It has a fibrous root system and produces a latex that can be used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
